data.title: Zed - The editor for what's next
data.description: Zed is a high-performance, multiplayer code editor from the creators of Atom and Tree-sitter.
data.content:
Zed - The editor for what's next
===============

[![Image 1: Zed Industries logo](https://www.zed.dev/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Flogo_icon.d67dc948.webp&w=3840&q=100)](https://www.zed.dev/)

*   [Releases](https://www.zed.dev/releases)
*   [Extensions](https://www.zed.dev/extensions)
*   [Docs](https://www.zed.dev/docs)
*   [Blog](https://www.zed.dev/blog)
*   Resources

*   Ctrl + Shift + P
*   [Talk to usT](https://cal.com/forms/0435d128-0460-46e9-8bf5-f433926de6be)
*   [DownloadD](https://www.zed.dev/download)

[tab tab tab tab tab tab Introducing: **Edit Prediction** tab tab tab tab tab tab](https://www.zed.dev/edit-prediction)

The editor for what's next
==========================

The editor for  
what's next
============================

Zed is a next-generation code editor designed for  
high-performance collaboration with humans and AI.

Zed is a next-generation code editor designed for high-performance collaboration with humans and AI.

[Download nowD](https://www.zed.dev/download)[Clone sourceC](https://github.com/zed-industries/zed)

Available for macOS, Linux, and soon for Windows

* * *

Fast

Written from scratch in Rust to efficiently leverage multiple CPU cores and your GPU.

Intelligent

Integrate upcoming LLMs into your workflow to generate, transform, and analyze code.

Collaborative

Chat with teammates, write notes together, and share your screen and project. All included.

![Image 2: Zed's UI](https://www.zed.dev/new-home/app.svg)

Fast

Written from scratch in Rust to efficiently leverage multiple CPU cores and your GPU.

Intelligent

Integrate upcoming LLMs into your workflow to generate, transform, and analyze code.

Collaborative

Chat with teammates, write notes together, and share your screen and project. All included.

* * *

World-class developers use Zed
------------------------------

Trusted by industry-leading teams.

> I've had my mind blown using Zed with Claude 3.5 Sonnet. I wrote up a few sentences around a research idea and Claude 3.5 Sonnet delivered a first pass in seconds. When I spotted some small mistakes, I highlighted the parts I wanted to change and shared feedback for it to fix. I was able to go from idea to running experiment code in half an hourâ€”it was really easy and fun.

![Image 3: Ethan Perez's picture](https://www.zed.dev/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Favatars.githubusercontent.com%2Fu%2F6402205%3Fv%3D4&w=64&q=75)

Ethan Perez

Adversarial Robustness Research Lead

> Yes! Now I can have shortcuts to run and debug tests. Ever since snippets were added, Zed has all of the features I could ask for in an editor.

![Image 4: JosÃ© Valim's picture](https://www.zed.dev/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Favatars.githubusercontent.com%2Fu%2F9582%3Fv%3D4&w=64&q=75)

JosÃ© Valim

Creator of Elixir

> This is obviously a product built with love and care. I can tell it from two minutes of using it. Kudos to the team.

![Image 5: Dan Abramov's picture](https://www.zed.dev/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Favatars.githubusercontent.com%2Fu%2F810438%3Fv%3D4&w=64&q=75)

Dan Abramov

Engineer and React Core team member

> My god it is so fast. Boot time, UI interaction, typing latency. I feel it. I knew VS Code always felt sluggish, but I didn't realize how good things could really be. I'm honestly astounded.

![Image 6: Matt Baker's picture](https://www.zed.dev/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Favatars.githubusercontent.com%2Fu%2F55462%3Fv%3D4&w=64&q=75)

Matt Baker

Principal Engineer

> Iâ€™ve started using Zed, and I love it. Lots of subtle innovations (multibuffers, inlay hints, collaboration). Thoughtful, precise design. And the speed, the speed!

![Image 7: Mike Bostock's picture](https://www.zed.dev/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Favatars.githubusercontent.com%2Fu%2F230541%3Fv%3D4&w=64&q=75)

Mike Bostock

Creator of D3.js, founder of Observable

* * *

![Image 8: Zed's logo](https://www.zed.dev/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Flogo_wordmark_white_bigger.2c31c722.png&w=3840&q=100)

Forever shipping

Zed just works
--------------

Incredibly powerful out of the box. And it only gets better as, every week, there's always a new version.

[View all releases](https://www.zed.dev/releases)

Most Recent Release

[Learn More â†’](https://www.zed.dev/edit-prediction)

Edit Prediction

A tool that anticipates your next move. Powered by Zeta, our new open-source, open-data language model.

[Learn More â†’](https://www.zed.dev/remote-development)Expand Video

Remote Development

Your machine only runs the Zed UI, while the actual codebase runs on a remote server.

[Learn More â†’](https://www.zed.dev/docs/multibuffers)Expand Video

Multibuffer editing

Multibuffers compose excerpts from across the codebase in one editable surface.

[Learn More â†’](https://www.zed.dev/docs/repl)Expand Video

Interactive programming

Evaluate and interactively run code inline via Jupyter runtimes.

[Learn More â†’](https://www.zed.dev/docs/configuring-languages)Expand Video

Multi-language

Support for many languages via Tree-sitter, WebAssembly, and the Language Server Protocol.

[Learn More â†’](https://www.zed.dev/docs/tasks)Expand Video

Terminal and task runner

Fast native terminal tightly integrates with Zed's language-aware task runner and AI capabilities.

[Learn More â†’](https://www.zed.dev/docs/vim)Expand Video

Vim-friendly

First-class modal editing via Vim bindings, including features like text objects and marks.

Edit Prediction

A tool that anticipates your next move. Powered by Zeta, our new open-source, open-data language model.

Remote Development

Your machine only runs the Zed UI, while the actual codebase runs on a remote server.

Multibuffer editing

Multibuffers compose excerpts from across the codebase in one editable surface.

Interactive programming

Evaluate and interactively run code inline via Jupyter runtimes.

Multi-language

Support for many languages via Tree-sitter, WebAssembly, and the Language Server Protocol.

Terminal and task runner

Fast native terminal tightly integrates with Zed's language-aware task runner and AI capabilities.

Vim-friendly

First-class modal editing via Vim bindings, including features like text objects and marks.

Stay in the loop for what's coming next.

[View our roadmap â†’](https://www.zed.dev/roadmap)

* * *

Open source

Zed is built by a global community of thousand of developers.

[Start contributing](https://github.com/zed-industries/zed)

Growing extensions ecosystem
----------------------------

Boost your Zed experience by choosing from hundreds of extensions that broaden language support, offer different themes, and more.

[Create an extension](https://zed.dev/docs/extensions/developing-extensions)

HTML

1.3M

HTML support.

All the little details

Built with ultimate care
------------------------

Every single feature in Zed has been designed to advance the state of the art. Anything less isnâ€™t worth building.

All the little details

Built with ultimate care
------------------------

Every single feature in Zed has been designed to advance the state of the art. Anything less isnâ€™t worth building.

Language Server Protocol support

Fully integrate your language of choice.

Outline view

Navigate through a file's symbols.

Text and line manipulation

Code efficiently with advanced text editing capacities.

Remote Development

Offset computing to the server.

A letter

From the team
-------------

Programming and the tools we use to do so are changing. As the culmination of 15 years of work developing  
industry-leading tools for developers like Atom, Electron,  
and Tree-sitter, Zed strives to be at the forefront of this transformation.

* * *

We're confident that the future of software development lies in seamless collaboration between humans and AI. Crafted from the ground up, Zed is here to make this vision a reality.
